Now obviously there are people like this right now and do you believe they are truely happy?
 
 Now the Buddist, scientists say they have found sufficient evidence to show that dedicated Buddists are constantly happier than the average person. They spend their lives trying to achieve this goal and I suppose if you try to do anything psychological to yourself for a long enough period of time, you will eventually achieve it. If we had a society that truely believed everyone should search out and find happiness and we removed a lot of the stressful things in this world, we would have something similar to the Buddists and perhaps people would be happier. So perhaps this is exactly what you were talking about in your post when you said we can make our reality whatever we want it to be.
 
 But I can't help but wonder, what would we be giving up in return to have a society like this one? Consider how far we have come as a species because we are always pushing ourselves to achieve the next level of development even if it means self-sacrafic. We can now fight disease, travel by airplane, feed billions of people, fly into outerspace, and do many other amazing things because we haven't settled for simply being happy with what we have in front of us. Maybe one day we will create an artificial way to be eternally happy, perhaps within our life times.
 
 Perhaps I'm just a person who gladly accepts the world as I see it today because society has gradually pushed this idea into my head. Maybe if I was to live my life in order to achieve happiness I wouldn't like the idea of the current society I'm in. But then comes another interesting development in this search for happiness. Wouldn't you agree that ignorance is bliss?
